page.title: 04Hadley Park
page.content: Across the NW corner of the map a minor road leading to Horton.To the south is a new road,the Leegomery by_pass which goes from Horton to Shawbirch. There is a{mill}nearby and it is disused.Some parts of the mill are old.On top of the mill it is like a castle with ramparts.That is why the area is known as Hadley Castle.It has been cared for by{G.K.N.Sankey Ltd}who have repaired it and re_roofed it.The mill continued to work as a watermill until the early 20th century. Near to the mill is a dairy farm with a large herd of Friesian cows. Leading from the farm is a path which goes to the disused Shropshire Union Canal(Trench Bbranch).There are three locks on this section of the canal,Turnip Lock,Peaty Lock and Hadley Lock.
